  • Method Details

    • createEmptyObject

      public static <T> T createEmptyObject​(Class<T> cls)
      Creates a new object of a given class without calling a constructor. This will initialise all fields to their default value. You can later set them via reflection. This can not create primitives and their wrappers, arrays, Class objects, enums or objects of abstract classes.

    • setFinalField

      public static void setFinalField​(Field field, Object instance, Object value)
      Sets the value to a field. This also works when the field is final.
      Parameters:
      field - The field that should get its value set.
      instance - The instance that should get its field value set. Can be null for static fields.
      value - The new value for the field.

    • createEnumConstant

      public static <T extends Enum<T>> T createEnumConstant​(Class<T> cls, String name)
      Creates a new enum constant for a given enum using a given name. The enum constant will be created without a constructor call. You'll need to initialise it via reflection. Duplicate enum names are not supported, so keep your enum name unique. If the enum value array is cached somewhere, you must hand updating this yourself. (Exception to this is the cache in the Class object for the enum. This is handles by the implementation itself. switches on that enum that have no default branch will throw an IncompatibleClassChangeError if used with the newly created enum constant. Also if a class containing an enum switch is loaded before the new enum constant was created, the switch will fail with an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.
      Parameters:
      cls - The enum class that should have a constant added.
      name - The name of the new enum constant.
      Returns:
      the new enum constant.
